title: Construction of a character
content:
Could anybody tell me what are the specific names given to parts of a character, if indeed they are named, e.g. the descender of a “g”, the horizontal cross through an “f”, etc.  
Are there different types of curve, lean or point/apex and is the dot of an “i” just a dot?  
“Serif” is about all I know!  
Thanks, Syd
author: Syd

comments.content:
you could browse the [terminology](http://web.archive.org/wiki/terminology) section of the [typowiki](http://web.archive.org/wiki/typowiki) and read up about the [eye](http://web.archive.org/wiki/eye), [ear](http://web.archive.org/wiki/ear), [terminal](http://web.archive.org/wiki/terminal), [ascender](http://web.archive.org/wiki/ascender), [descender](http://web.archive.org/wiki/descender), &c.

…or you could if it were working. \*pouting\*

Take a look here [http://counterspace.motivo.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126220811/http:/counterspace.motivo.com/) and here [http://www.thinkingwithtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126220811/http:/www.thinkingwithtype.com/)
Thanks both of you, that’s really helpful.
